data.title: Welcome to Iowa School for the Deaf
data.meta_description: At Iowa School for the Deaf, children thrive through communication, opportunity, independence and a sense of belonging for academic and social success.
data.text:
Welcome to Iowa

School for the Deaf

This is How We Thrive.

At Iowa School for the Deaf, children thrive through communication, opportunity, independence and a sense of belonging. Individualized attention through specialized staff ensures academic and social success, regardless of hearing level or communication preference. Visit our School and decide if we might be right for your child or student!

How we succeed.

Every day.

Through passionate, specialized staff, small successes within students occur every day, becoming large accomplishments every year. We invite you to explore our website and learn how our students thrive in a language-based academic and social environment.

Iowa School for the Deaf is not just a ‘special’ school. It is an extraordinary language and learning environment for children who sign, talk or use both communication methods. We welcome children who have cochlear implants, hearing aids or who use no assistive hearing devices. We value our students’ strengths and design individual learning goals centered around each student’s unique needs.

Keep Up With the Latest From ISD

Sweet success at annual fundraiser

Not only did attendees receive baskets of candy to take home on May Day, they brought home clearer understandings about the services and programs at Iowa School for the Deaf. The Iowa School for the Deaf Foundation held its annual scholarship and general fund fundraising event May 1. About 120 donors and friends of ISD… Continue Readingabout Sweet success at annual fundraiser

Superintendent named

The next superintendent for Iowa Educational Services for the Blind & Visually Impaired and Iowa School for the Deaf has been named. Link to details.… Continue Readingabout Superintendent named

GPSD Track Results

The Iowa Bobcats traveled to Kansas School for the Deaf in April to compete in the GPSD track meet. Here are the results. Win a scholarship with an essay

Deaf and hard-of-hearing students across Iowa have the opportunity to earn scholarships through this Optimist-sponsored contest. April 18, 202410 a.m. – 3 p.m.Iowa School for the Deaf Campus To compete you must: live in Iowa be in 10th, 11th or 12th grade be deaf or hard of hearing write and present and 4-5 minute speech… Continue Readingabout Win a scholarship with an essay

Saying and Signing Symposium is April 24

This free learning and fun event will be held at the Science Center of Iowa. Click for details… Continue Readingabout Saying and Signing Symposium is April 24

Deaf Cultural Celebration is April 6

The popular Deaf Cultural Celebration is back, this year with three national presenters who will entertain us with music and magic! Click here for more information.… Continue Readingabout Deaf Cultural Celebration is April 6

Iowa Department of Education and Innivee Strategies Launches Search for ISD and IESBVI Superintendent

This information in American Sign Language (ASL) The Iowa Department of Education is proud to announce a strategic partnership with Innivee Strategies, a Deaf-led leadership and organizational development firm, to lead the search for the next Iowa School for the Deaf (ISD) and Iowa Education Services for the Blind and Visually Impaired (IESBVI) Superintendent. The… Continue Readingabout Iowa Department of Education and Innivee Strategies Launches Search for ISD and IESBVI Superintendent

Get some net for the Class of 2025

Grab your buddies, tape up that old high school injury, and register for 6-on-6 volleyball and 3-on-3 basketball tournaments! These fast-paced fun events benefit the ISD Class of 2025. Email event coordinator with questions Basketball: Saturday, March 2, 2024 10 a.m. Lied Multipurpose Complex/Iowa School for the Deaf campus $80 per team/$3 per fan Deadline… Continue Readingabout Get some net for the Class of 2025

Foundation fundraiser is May 1

ASL information Celebrate May Day by supporting Iowa School for the Deaf students! This annual luncheon fundraiser provides scholarships to college-bound students and supports the general foundation. The event will be held Wednesday, May 1, 2024 from 11:30 a.m. – 1 p.m. in the Lied Multipurpose Complex on the campus of Iowa School for the… Continue Readingabout Foundation fundraiser is May 1

Referral & Enrollment

Do you know a student who would benefit from ISD’s learning environment? In addition to K-12 programming, we have a preschool and the state’s only transition-to-work/college program exclusively for students who are deaf or hard of hearing.

Opportunities for Students Across Iowa

We provide resources and opportunities for Iowa students who are deaf or hard of hearing. Whether or not your child is enrolled at ISD, take advantage of our resources for families, language and literacy, assessments and extended learning opportunities.

Living and Learning at ISD

At Iowa School for the Deaf, children thrive through communication, opportunity, independence and a sense of belonging. Individualized attention through specialized staff ensures academic and social success, regardless of hearing level or communication preference. Tour ISD and decide if we might be right for your child or student!
